Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Michael Lynch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Activity:  Plea and sentencing hearing  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:23 PM Defendant Jeremy Michael Lynch in court in custody by video with attorney Jason D Sanders by video.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom.  Defendant enters guilty plea to count 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 3 and 4 dismissed and read in.  Court orders sentence withheld and places defendant on probation for 2 years consecutive to any sentence now serving.  No credit.  Costs due in 60 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Activity:Preliminary hearing/arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:16 PM Defendant Jeremy Michael Lynch in court by video in custody with attorney C. James Fitzgerald by video.  David Zarwell and Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.   Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court, jury trial to be set.

Activity:  Adjourned initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:10 PM Defendant Jeremy Michael Lynch in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Jason D Sanders by video.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Matter continued for Attorney to speak to Defendant.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:40 PM Defendant Jeremy Michael Lynch in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney C. James Fitzgerald by video.  Emmeline Lee and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court sets $500 Cash bond with conditions: No driving without a valid drivers license or valid insurance.  No contact directly or indirectly with victims J.H.L., T.M.L. or N.R.W., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Matter continued for decision on Preliminary Hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 3:00 PM.
